title: 111_hr1824
content: The Act may be cited as the "Best Buddies Empowerment for People with Intellectual Disabilities Act of 2009". Best Buddies is a national organization dedicated to helping people with intellectual disabilities integrate into mainstream society by promoting friendships with non-disabled peers. Since 1989, they have provided opportunities for 1-to-1 friendships and integrated employment, aiming to end social isolation and enhance the lives of individuals with intellectual disabilities. Best Buddies is an international organization with programs for middle school, high school, and college students with intellectual disabilities, creating 1-to-1 friendships between them. They aim to positively impact over 400,000 individuals in 2009 and 500,000 by 2010. The Best Buddies organization offers various programs to support individuals with intellectual disabilities, including e-mail friendships, 1-to-1 friendships with adults in the corporate and civic communities, and supported employment. The Act aims to increase participation in these programs, dispel negative stereotypes, and highlight the contributions of people with intellectual disabilities. The Act aims to provide assistance for Best Buddies organization, supporting individuals with intellectual disabilities through various programs. The Secretary of Education may award grants to Best Buddies for activities promoting the expansion of the organization, increasing participation of individuals with intellectual disabilities in community life. Funds cannot be used for medical treatment, and administrative expenses are limited to 5%. Non-Federal funds can also be used by Best Buddies. The Secretary of Education may award grants to Best Buddies for activities promoting the expansion of the organization and increasing participation of individuals with intellectual disabilities in community life. To be eligible for funding, Best Buddies must submit an application with details on planned activities and measurable goals. Additionally, they must agree to submit an annual report to receive funds. Best Buddies must submit an annual report under section 3(a) with information required by the Secretary of Education. The report should describe progress towards meeting specific goals outlined in their application. Authorization of appropriations for grants, contracts, or cooperative agreements under section 3(a) is set at $10,000,000 for fiscal year 2010, with additional funding as needed for the following 4 years.
